text: I wanted to create a throwaway "struct" object to keep various status flags.
My first approach was this (javascript style)

code:
>>> status = object()
>>> status.foo = 3  
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
AttributeError: 'object' object has no attribute 'foo'

text: Definitely not what I expected, because this works:
I guess this is because object() does not have a __dict__.
I don't want to use a dictionary, and assuming I don't want to create the Anon object, is there another solution ?
